description: The Unified Tournament Circuit is a regional circuit for Warhammer 40k and Age of Sigmar which covers the area between Virginia and Newfoundland. In case you missed our announcement, you can find it here. You can find the full calendar of UTC events here. Last Weekend’s Event The UTC is back in full swing with […]
title: UTC Weekend Recap and Preview: April 5, 2024

description: In this life, there are a great many pleasures, but what are the most essential? The urges that truly make us who we are? Yeah, you’ve got your Hedonites of Slaanesh engaging in all that decadent perfumery and getting down to business, but on the other side of that indulgent coin we find the subjects of […]
title: Lore Explainer: The Ogor Mawtribes

description: Plague Garden by Josh Reynolds is one of the seminal early-days Age of Sigmar novels. It didn’t contain any meta-altering plot, but it did contribute massively to the tone and character of what would come after. Indeed, any Age of Sigmar book that has the words Josh Reynolds on the cover is going to be […]
title: Plague Garden by Josh Reynolds: The Goonhammer Review

description: Stormbringer is a weekly hobby magazine from Hachette Partworks introducing players to Warhammer: Age of Sigmar. In this 80-week series, our intrepid magazine-receiver will be reviewing each individual issue, its included models, and gaming materials. A Premium US subscription was provided to Goonhammer for review purposes. If you want to follow along at home, US […]
title: SRM’s Ongoing Stormbringer Review: Week 20

description: Adepticon 2024 is done and in the books, and I cannot be happier that I went OR that it is over. Even though I only played one game, Adepticon has so much going on that it can quickly become overwhelming. I think putting things in chronological order is as good an organizing method as any, […]
title: “Contemptor” Kevin’s Adepticon 2024: Return to Adepticon!

description: It’s Friday, so that means it’s time for the epic conclusion of this week’s Competitive Innovations, just in time for you to all go out and play more events. We’ll get that boulder up the hill eventually. It’s Lowest of Men in charge, and today we’re covering: Rataclysm 2024 Iron Cage GT: Bedford Beatdown Wild Hunt […]
title: Competitive Innovations in 10th: Five Alarm Phaerons pt.3

description: Welcome back to our Best Year in Gaming March Madness bracket competition! Yesterday we polished off the Southeast Conference with matchups between 1996 and 2010 and 2002 vs. 2018. Both ended up being relatively close – particularly ’96 vs. 2010. But as has been happening in the competition, it seems like the Goonhammer Patrons value […]
title: The Best Year in Gaming: The Northwest Conference, Part 1

description: Last year’s stacked lineup of games for the Game Awards had us thinking: What was the best year in gaming? As part of our series on determining gaming’s best year, we’re putting together an article on each year, charting the major releases and developments of the year, and talking about both their impact and what […]
title: The Best Year in Gaming: 1998

description: John from Can You Roll a Crit? is back with all the Kill Team tournament stats for March! He covers the global competitive results from winrates to tournament wins, analysing how each faction is performing in the current tournament circuit and whether the March dataslate changes were reflective of the stats!
title: CYRAC: Kill Team March Tournament Stats
